summary_points: 1. Western Digital Corporation (WDC) completed the separation of its Flash business into a separate public company, Sandisk Corporation (SNDK), on February 21, 2025.
2.  As of Q2 2025, WDC's preliminary unaudited total assets were $25,456 million, while total liabilities were $13,110 million.
3. Beginning in the third quarter of fiscal 2025, Sandisk's historical results will be reported as discontinued operations in WDC's consolidated financial statements.

1. On April 4, 2025, PayPal Holdings, Inc. announced that Rodney Adkins will not stand for re-election to the Board of Directors at the 2025 Annual Meeting in June, resulting in a reduction of the Board's size to 11 directors.
2.  The SEC filing is an 8-K report, indicating a current report filed on April 7, 2025, concerning a specific event rather than regular financial reporting.
3.  No specific future impacts or risks are detailed numerically in this section of the filing beyond the board size reduction.
1. On April 7, 2025, Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. completed two registered direct offerings of ordinary shares, raising $64,005,553 in cash and 3,358,098 shares.

2.  Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. exchanged $353,876,000 in aggregate principal amount of 5.375% Exchangeable Senior Notes due 2025 for $353,876,000 in aggregate principal amount of newly issued 0.875% Exchangeable Senior Notes due 2030, and a $64,005,553 cash payment.

3. The 2030 Notes are exchangeable at the holder's option, with an initial exchange rate of 38.1570 ordinary shares per $1,000 principal amount, representing a 37.5% premium above the offering price in the Equity Offerings.
1. On April 7, 2025, VICI Properties L.P. completed a debt offering of $1.3 billion in notes, due 2028 and 2035, to refinance existing debt maturing in May and June 2025.
2. The offering consisted of $400 million in 4.750% notes due 2028 and $900 million in 5.625% notes due 2035.
3.  VICI LP’s subsidiaries may be required to guarantee the new notes under certain circumstances related to existing guarantees under a credit agreement dated February 3, 2025.
1. On April 6, 2025, Match Group appointed Darrell Cavens to its Board of Directors, strengthening its expertise in digital commerce and technology.
2.  Match Group will seek stockholder approval to declassify its board at its 2025 annual meeting, changing director terms from staggered three-year terms to one-year terms.

3.  The Match Group board is recommending against the Anson Funds' nominees for directors, citing a lack of relevant skills and expertise and noting that Anson Funds owns less than 0.5% of the company's common stock.

1. CoStar Group, Inc. added three new independent directors (Christine M. McCarthy, John Berisford, and Rachel C. Glaser) to its board and appointed Louise S. Sams as Chairperson, effective April 6, 2025, while three other board members resigned.
2.  As of Q4 2024, CoStar Group's websites attracted over 134 million average monthly unique visitors.

3.  D. E. Shaw & Co., L.P., D. E. Shaw Oculus Portfolios, L.L.C., and Third Point LLC entered into support agreements with CoStar Group, Inc., agreeing to standstill provisions and voting agreements for a period ending at least 30 days prior to the 2026 annual meeting.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$657,550,457.01 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of April 4th, 2025, under a stock repurchase program authorized for up to US$1 billion.
2. As of April 4th, 2025,  21,450,977 Class A shares and 10,586,069 Class B shares were repurchased.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, ongoing as of April 7th, 2025, aims to enhance shareholder value but is subject to market conditions and other factors, with no guaranteed future impact.
1. Rasesh Patel, Executive Vice President of NRG Consumer, retired from NRG Energy, Inc. on May 19, 2025, after notifying the company on April 7, 2025.
2.  NRG Energy anticipates appointing Patel's replacement by the end of the second quarter of 2025.
3. Patel will remain with the company in an advisory capacity to assist with the transition of his responsibilities.
1. Healthpeak Properties, Inc.'s Chief Financial Officer, Peter A. Scott, resigned on April 2, 2025, to become CEO of Healthcare Realty Trust Incorporated.
2.  The company anticipates naming an internal successor within the coming weeks.
3. Mr. Scott's resignation was voluntary and he is not entitled to any severance payment.
